instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 3476 with ASD Error...
threads.message:
Had a 3476 with some issues, no start, no power, then it would start but kernel panic. Replaced corroded <RESISTOR>R8185</RESISTOR> and trace. powered up but kernel panicked.  Ran ASD that failed. Said "ASD-Sensor Failure Voltage VD0R DC-in Failed Value 19.86"
and
Error 2 Sensor reading above alarm point

Any idea what this means?

threads.title: 3476 with ASD Error...
threads.message:
DC In Voltage Sense & Enable (VD0R), page 40.
Check <TRANSISTOR>Q5490</TRANSISTOR> area for corrosion.
<RESISTOR>R5499</RESISTOR> open/corroded, or higher value?

threads.title: 3476 with ASD Error...
threads.message: Are you using an 85W charger?? Try a 60W charger... Original of course...

threads.title: 3476 with ASD Error...
threads.message:
No Title

[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 40348"]DC In Voltage Sense & Enable (VD0R), page 40.
Check <TRANSISTOR>Q5490</TRANSISTOR> area for corrosion.
<RESISTOR>R5499</RESISTOR> open/corroded, or higher value?[/QUOTE]

I actually changed out <TRANSISTOR>Q5490</TRANSISTOR> as there was a small amount of corrosion near it. I ran ASD a couple times and it passed. However it still

threads.title: 3476 with ASD Error...
threads.message: Did you try your USB OSX for test?
